intro: Martrasia pubescens, commonly known as the hairy martrasia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, pubescent stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
